info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 07 at 6:20PM EDT until August 07 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MADISON COUNTY... At 620 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over De Ruyter, or 14 miles west of Hamilton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Eaton, Hamilton, Morrisville, Nelson, Lebanon, Georgetown, Pierceville, Erieville, West Eaton and Sheds. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central New York. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
